content.raw: Note that `ZIP_FIND_QUIETLY` is a variable that is automatically provided when `FindZIP.cmake` is called by `find_package(~)`, so it'll be ready to use right away. You don't need to worry about setting its value yourself.
content.html: Note that ZIP_FIND_QUIETLY is a variable that is automatically provided when FindZIP.cmake is called by find_package(~), so it'll be ready to use right away. You don't need to worry about setting its value yourself.

content.raw: Per [this discussion](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/pull-requests/32/add-findzipcmake/activity#comment-53389889) I think we should actually remove the `if(UNIX)` condition here.
content.html: Per this discussion I think we should actually remove the if(UNIX) condition here.

content.raw:
Yeah, that situation was specific to UUID.

For better or worse, we do generate `pkg-config` files when building on Windows, and for that to be done correctly, we still need to call at least one of the `IgnPkgConfig` macros, whether that be `ign_pkg_check_modules_quiet` or `ign_pkg_config_entry`. UUID is an exception since it doesn't exist on Windows.

If anyone believes that we should *not* be generating a `pkg-config` file for our projects on Windows, I am totally open to relaxing that requirement. I am genuinely not sure whether anyone does/can use `pkg-config` in a sane way on Windows, but I figure it's better for us to provide it without anyone needing it than have someone need it without us providing it.
content.html:
Yeah, that situation was specific to UUID.

For better or worse, we do generate pkg-config files when building on Windows, and for that to be done correctly, we still need to call at least one of the IgnPkgConfig macros, whether that be ign_pkg_check_modules_quiet or ign_pkg_config_entry. UUID is an exception since it doesn't exist on Windows.

If anyone believes that we should not be generating a pkg-config file for our projects on Windows, I am totally open to relaxing that requirement. I am genuinely not sure whether anyone does/can use pkg-config in a sane way on Windows, but I figure it's better for us to provide it without anyone needing it than have someone need it without us providing it.

content.raw: I did this for UUID in pull request #21, but I guess that was because we use system libraries for UUID on windows, so I guess that was different.
content.html: I did this for UUID in pull request #21, but I guess that was because we use system libraries for UUID on windows, so I guess that was different.

content.raw: Is this valid cmake syntax? I don't think I've seen or heard of separating the `end` from the `if` before.
content.html: Is this valid cmake syntax? I don't think I've seen or heard of separating the end from the if before.

content.raw:
The line `include(IgnPkgConfig)` should always be safe.

As far as I can figure, calling `ign_pkg_check_modules[_quiet]` should also be safe on Windows, it just might not accomplish anything since pkg-config might not be available.

Have you run into issues where calling one of the `IgnPkgConfig` macros causes an error or warning? If so, that's something that should be fixed in `IgnPkgConfig`.
content.html:
The line include(IgnPkgConfig) should always be safe.

As far as I can figure, calling ign_pkg_check_modules[_quiet] should also be safe on Windows, it just might not accomplish anything since pkg-config might not be available.

Have you run into issues where calling one of the IgnPkgConfig macros causes an error or warning? If so, that's something that should be fixed in IgnPkgConfig.

content.raw:
We should prefer to wrap these message printouts (including the ones on lines 27 and 39) with

```
if(NOT ZIP_FIND_QUIETLY)
  message(...)
endif()
```

so that we respect the wishes of the caller.

Other than that, this find-module looks good to me.
content.html:
We should prefer to wrap these message printouts (including the ones on lines 27 and 39) with

if(NOT ZIP_FIND_QUIETLY)
  message(...)
endif()

so that we respect the wishes of the caller.

Other than that, this find-module looks good to me.
